description: APPLICATION FOR THE DEMOLITION OF EXISTING REAR GLASS ROOF AND GARAGE. THE PROPOSED CONSTRUCTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR AND SIDE EXTENSIONS AND A PROPOSED HIP TO GABLE AND REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSION AND THE INSTALLATION OF EXTERNAL WALL INSULATION, PHOTOVOLTAIC PANELS AND AIR SOURCE HEAT PUMP.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [PA-2406-00-001,
PA-2406-00-002,
PA-2406-00-201 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-202 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-203 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-204 - Rev.B,
PA-2406-00-211,
PA-2406-00-212 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-213 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-214 - Rev.A,
PA-2406-00-221 - Rev.A]

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Obscured Glazing - Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the windows in the side elevation at roof level, shall be glazed with obscured glass and shall be maintained as such thereafter.

Condition : 5 - The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity.

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Local Plan 2024 policies for Merton: F15.7 and F15.8

Condition : 6 - The development hereby approved shall implement the fire safety measures as submitted with the proposal titled: Fire Safety Statement. These measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity. 

Reason: To ensure that the development complies with policy D12 of the London Plan 2021

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

ii) The application was amended following negotiations with the Council to ensure the scheme complied with adopted policy and guidance, and a decision was made [without delay/ with an agreed determination date].

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
The London Borough of Merton's Environmental Health Service set out that normally the hours for noisy works are:
8am - 6pm on Monday to Friday
8am - 1pm on Saturday
no noisy works on Sundays and Bank Holidays
Further details can be found here: https://www.merton.gov.uk/communities-and-neighbourhoods/noise-nuisance/report-nuisance/building-noise

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.

Condition : 10 - INFORMATIVE (Party Wall Act) - The applicant is advised to check the requirements of the Party Wall Act 1996 relating to work on an existing wall shared with another property, building on the boundary with a neighbouring property, or excavating near a neighbouring building. Further information is available at the following link: 
https://www.gov.uk/party-walls-building-works

Condition : 11 - INFORMATIVE
